title: The Charm of the Highway Strip
seoTitle: The Charm of the Highway Strip
socialTitle: The Magnetic Fields: The Charm of the Highway Strip
dek: Each Sunday, Pitchfork takes an in-depth look at a significant album from the past, and any record not in our archives is eligible. Today, we revisit Stephin Merrit’s 1994 meta-country album, an idiosyncratic, lo-fi travelogue bursting with gothic wit and pathos.
